findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: Hash collisions can occur when using multiple variable length arguments, potentially leading to authentication bypass via capture-replay attacks.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a potential vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur with a function type variable, which may lead to unintended behavior or security risks.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: Insufficient control flow management leading to potential gas griefing attacks.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The contract has an incorrect inheritance order which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature allows an attacker to manipulate or replay signatures.
